review.body:
## Summary of Changes Hello @Richanger, I'm Gemini Code Assist[^1]! I'm currently reviewing this pull request and will post my feedback shortly. In the meantime, here's a summary to help you and other reviewers quickly get up to speed! This pull request addresses two display issues related to album images: correcting the image flip behavior and repositioning the 'Platz' information. The primary goal is to ensure that when an album image is flipped, the correct back image is displayed, rather than the reverse side of the front image. Additionally, it streamlines the user interface by moving the 'Platz' box from an overlay on the image to a more appropriate location, avoiding duplicate information. ### Highlights * **Album Image Flip Fix**: The issue where the back of the front image was visible instead of the true back image during a flip animation has been resolved. This was achieved by adding the `-webkit-backface-visibility: hidden` CSS property to both `.face` and `.face img` elements, ensuring that only the intended back image is displayed upon flipping. * **"Platz" Box Display Adjustment**: The 'Platz' box overlay, which previously appeared directly on the album image, has been removed from this position. This adjustment was made because the 'Platz' information is already displayed in the header, thus eliminating redundancy and improving the overall visual layout.
Using Gemini Code Assist
The full guide for Gemini Code Assist can be found on our [documentation page](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/review-github-code), here are some quick tips. Invoking Gemini You can request assistance from Gemini at any point in your pull request via creating an issue comment (i.e. comment on the pull request page) using either `/gemini ` or `@gemini-code-assist `. Below is a summary of the supported commands. Feature | Command | Description --- | --- | --- Code Review | `/gemini review` | Performs a code review for the current pull request in its current state. Pull Request Summary | `/gemini summary` | Provides a summary of the current pull request in its current state. Comment | @gemini-code-assist | Responds in comments when explicitly tagged, both in issue comments and review comments. Help | `/gemini help` | Displays a list of available commands. Customization To customize Gemini Code Assist for GitHub experience, repository maintainers can create a configuration file and/or provide a custom code review style guide (such as PEP-8 for Python) by creating and adding files to a `.gemini/` folder in the base of the repository. Detailed instructions can be found [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github). Limitations & Feedback Gemini Code Assist may make mistakes. Please leave feedback on any instances where its feedback is incorrect or counter productive. You can react with :thumbsup: and :thumbsdown: on @gemini-code-assist comments. If you're interested in giving your feedback about your experience with Gemini Code Assist for Github and other Google products, sign up [here](https://google.qualtrics.com/jfe/form/SV_2cyuGuTWsEw84yG). You can also get AI-powered code generation, chat, as well as code reviews directly in the IDE at no cost with the [Gemini Code Assist IDE Extension](https://cloud.google.com/products/gemini/code-assist).
[^1]: Review the [Privacy Notices](https://policies.google.com/privacy), [Generative AI Prohibited Use Policy](https://policies.google.com/terms/generative-ai/use-policy), [Terms of Service](https://policies.google.com/terms), and learn how to configure Gemini Code Assist in GitHub [here](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github). Gemini can make mistakes, so double check it and [use code with caution](https://support.google.com/legal/answer/13505487).

pull_request.title: Fix album back image and platz box display
pull_request.body: Fix album image flip to show actual back image and move "Platz" box above images. The flip issue was due to missing `-webkit-backface-visibility` on image elements, causing the back of the front image to be visible instead of the true back image. The "Platz" box overlay was removed from the image as it is already displayed in the header. ---

pull_request.title: Доминатор pvrsifvlAlt (ex1stenz )
pull_request.body:
<!-- ЭТО ШАБЛОН ВАШЕГО PULL REQUEST. ТЕКСТ МЕЖДУ СТРЕЛКАМИ - ЭТО КОММЕНТАРИИ, ОНИ НЕ БУДУТ ВИДНЫ В ОПИСАНИИ PR. -->

## Описание PR
<!-- Что вы изменили? -->
Добавлен Пистолет ОСЩ и Доминатор, всё по заказу, так же изменения свечения у crusher'a доминатора и шлема скафандра.
## Почему / Зачем / Баланс
<!-- Обсудите, как это повлияет на баланс игры или объясните, почему это было изменено. Укажите ссылки на соответствующие обсуждения, предложение или issue. -->

## Технические детали
<!-- Краткое описание изменений в коде для облегчения проверки. -->
Папки с текстурами dominator.rsi и gun.rsi, изменения в файле pvrsifvlAlt.yml
## Медиа
<!-- Прикрепите медиафайлы, если PR вносит изменения в игру (одежда, предметы, механики и т.д.).
Небольшие исправления/рефакторинг освобождаются от этого требования. -->

## Требования
<!-- Подтвердите следующее, поставив X в скобках [X]: -->
- [X] PR полностью завершён и мне не нужна помощь чтобы его закончить.
- [X] Я внимательно просмотрел все свои изменения и багов в них не нашёл.
- [ ] Я запускал локальный сервер со своими изменениями и всё протестировал.
- [ ] Я добавил скриншот/видео демонстрации PR в игре, **или** этот PR этого не требует.

## Критические изменения
<!-- Перечислите все критические изменения, включая изменения пространств имен, публичных классов/методов/полей, переименования прототипов; и предоставьте инструкции по их исправлению. -->

**Список изменений**
<!-- Добавьте запись в Changelog, чтобы игроки знали о новых функциях или изменениях, которые могут повлиять на игровой процесс.
В журнал изменений следует помещать только то, что действительно важно игрокам. Если вы добавили музыку для ивента - это не важно. 
Если вы понёрфили пули христова - это важно. Убедитесь, что вы вынесли этот шаблон Changelog из блока комментариев, чтобы он отображался..
Changelog должен иметь символ :cl:, чтобы бот распознал изменения и добавил их в список изменений игры. -->
<!--
:cl:
- add: Добавлено веселье!
- remove: Удалено веселье!
- tweak: Изменено веселье!
- fix: Исправлено веселье!
-->

Organize ideas and collaborate using Markdown, a lightweight language for text formatting. --- ✨ **This is an interactive, hands-on GitHub Skills exercise!** As you complete each step, I’ll leave updates in the comments: - ✅ Check your work and guide you forward - 💡 Share helpful tips and resources - 🚀 Celebrate your progress and completion Let’s get started - good luck and have fun! — Mona

comment.body:
## Step 2: Make a list Markdown supports 3 types of common lists. They include: - [Unordered](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax#lists) - Bulleted list - [Ordered](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax#lists) - Number list - [Task](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/getting-started-with-writing-and-formatting-on-github/basic-writing-and-formatting-syntax#task-lists) - Checkbox list ### Unordered list An unordered list is simple to show. Each item is placed on its own line using a `-`, `*`, or `+` character. ```md - Item 1 - Item 2 - Item 3 ``` - Item 1 - Item 2 - Item 3 ### Ordered List A list is changed to ordered by using any number instead of the list character. Notice how markdown automatically handles the counting. Nice! ```md 1. Step 1 1. Step 2 1. Step 3 ``` 1. Step 1 1. Step 2 1. Step 3 ### Task List A task list is extends the unordered list to use check boxes. Add empty brackets `[ ]` for incomplete tasks and filled brackets `[x]` for complete tasks. Note: The empty required space for empty brackets. ```md - [x] This task is complete - [ ] This task is not complete ``` - [x] This task is complete - [ ] This task is not complete > [!TIP] > Issues and pull requests can use task syntax for [conveying progress](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/writing-on-github/working-with-advanced-formatting/about-tasklists). ### :keyboard: Activity: Add ideas and goals to our morning plan 1. On the `start-blog` branch, open the `day-1.md` file for editing. 1. Add the following task list below **morning planning** level two heading to track goals you want to achieve. ```md - [ ] Check out the [github blog](https://github.blog/) for topic ideas. - [ ] Learn about [GitHub Pages](https://skills.github.com/#first-day-on-github). - [ ] Convert my first blog post into an actual webpage. ``` 1. Use the **Preview** tab to check your Markdown formatting. 1. In the top right, click the **Commit changes** button and commit directly to the `start-blog` branch. 1. With our code block committed, Mona should be busy reviewing your work and preparing the next steps.
Having trouble? 🤷
- Confirm you are editing the correct file and branch. - Double check your syntax. The must be a space inside the `[ ]` for task lists.

issue.title: Research: Film Festival Data Sources - Scraping vs APIs vs Wikidata for Top 8 Festivals
issue.body:
# Film Festival Data Sources Research: Comprehensive Analysis

## Objective

Research the best data sources for importing winners from the top 8 film festivals to extend our Oscar-style sophisticated award system vs. simple IMDB list scraping approach.

## Current State Analysis

### Our Existing Oscar System (Sophisticated)
**Source**: oscars.org via Zyte API  
**Architecture**: Relational model with `oscar_ceremonies`, `oscar_categories`, `oscar_nominations` tables  
**Data Quality**: Excellent - structured, comprehensive, includes nominees and winners  
**Maintenance**: Active - scraper working, handles 22+ categories, person tracking

### Our IMDB List System (Simple)
**Source**: IMDB user lists via `ImdbCanonicalScraper`  
**Architecture**: JSONB storage in `movies.canonical_sources`  
**Data Quality**: Limited - winners only, basic metadata, no categories  
**Maintenance**: Stable - proven scraper, works for 1001 Movies, Criterion, etc.

## Top 8 Film Festivals Research

### 1. 🏆 Academy Awards (Oscars) - ✅ IMPLEMENTED
**Status**: ✅ Fully implemented with sophisticated system  
**Source**: oscars.org  
**Quality**: Excellent - comprehensive ceremony data  
**GitHub**: Multiple repos (DLu/oscar_data, turgeonmaxime/oscar-db)  
**Architecture**: Full relational model with 22+ categories

### 2. 🎬 Cannes Film Festival - 🟡 MIXED SOURCES
**Official Website**: festival-cannes.com/en/retrospective/  
**Scrapability**: ❌ Poor - no structured awards data on individual year pages  
**GitHub Solutions**: ✅ rurban/cannes-ratings (comprehensive ratings data in Perl)  
**IMDB Lists**: ✅ Multiple lists available (ls527026601 - 297 titles)  
**Wikidata**: ✅ Comprehensive Palme d'Or data available via SPARQL  

**Recommendation**: Start with IMDB list (ls527026601), enhance with Wikidata SPARQL

### 3. 🦁 Venice Film Festival - ✅ GITHUB SOLUTION FOUND
**Official Website**: labiennale.org  
**Scrapability**: ❌ Limited structured data  
**GitHub Solutions**: ✅ **ali-ce/python-leoni** - Scrapes Wikipedia for Golden Lion winners  
**IMDB Lists**: ✅ Available (ls020806626)  
**Wikidata**: ✅ Golden Lion data available  

**Recommendation**: Use ali-ce/python-leoni as reference, combine with Wikidata

### 4. 🐻 Berlin Film Festival (Berlinale) - 🟡 OFFICIAL ARCHIVES
**Official Website**: berlinale.de/en/archive/awards-juries/awards.html  
**Scrapability**: 🟡 Has official archives, structure unclear  
**GitHub Solutions**: ❌ None found specifically for Golden Bear  
**IMDB Lists**: ✅ Available (ls063481391)  
**Wikidata**: ✅ Golden Bear data available  

**Recommendation**: Start with IMDB list, investigate official archive structure

### 5. 🍿 Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) - ✅ OFFICIAL API POTENTIAL
**Official Website**: tiff.net/awards  
**Scrapability**: ✅ Good - structured awards announcements  
**GitHub Solutions**: ❌ None found  
**IMDB Lists**: ❌ Not readily available  
**Wikidata**: ✅ People's Choice Award data available  

**Recommendation**: Official website scraping - clean structure, annual announcements

### 6. 🎭 British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA) - 🟡 OFFICIAL ARCHIVES
**Official Website**: bafta.org/awards/  
**Scrapability**: 🟡 Has searchable database  
**GitHub Solutions**: ❌ None specific to BAFTA (but Oscar scrapers as templates)  
**IMDB Lists**: ✅ Multiple lists available  
**Wikidata**: ✅ BAFTA data available  

**Recommendation**: Hybrid approach - IMDB lists + official website investigation

### 7. 🌟 Sundance Film Festival - 📊 LIMITED SCOPE
**Official Website**: sundance.org  
**Awards**: Audience Award, Grand Jury Prize  
**GitHub Solutions**: ❌ None found  
**Data Quality**: Lower cultural relevance for CRI  

**Recommendation**: Lower priority - focus on top 6 first

### 8. 🎯 Critics Choice Awards - 📊 LIMITED SCOPE
**Official Website**: criticschoice.com  
**Awards**: Multiple TV/Film categories  
**Cultural Impact**: Lower than film festivals  

**Recommendation**: Lower priority for initial implementation

## Data Source Quality Matrix

| Festival | Official Site | GitHub Repo | IMDB Lists | Wikidata | Best Source |
|----------|---------------|-------------|------------|----------|-------------|
| Oscars | ✅ Excellent | ✅ Multiple | ✅ Available | ✅ Complete | Official (implemented) |
| Cannes | ❌ Poor | ✅ ratings-only | ✅ Good | ✅ Complete | **Wikidata + IMDB** |
| Venice | ❌ Limited | ✅ Golden Lion | ✅ Available | ✅ Complete | **GitHub + Wikidata** |
| Berlin | 🟡 Archive | ❌ None | ✅ Available | ✅ Complete | **IMDB + Wikidata** |
| TIFF | ✅ Good | ❌ None | ❌ Limited | ✅ Available | **Official Site** |
| BAFTA | 🟡 Database | ❌ None | ✅ Available | ✅ Complete | **IMDB + Official** |

## Key GitHub Repositories Found

### 1. **rurban/cannes-ratings** - Cannes Critics Data
- **Language**: Perl
- **Data**: Comprehensive critics ratings from multiple Cannes years
- **Files**: Cannes2018.dat, Cannes2020.dat, Cannes2021.dat, Cannes2024.dat, Cannes2025.dat
- **Usefulness**: Statistical analysis, but not winners data

### 2. **ali-ce/python-leoni** - Venice Golden Lion Winners
- **Language**: Python (requests, lxml, pandas, matplotlib)
- **Source**: Italian Wikipedia (it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leone_d'oro_al_miglior_film)
- **Output**: CSV with winners data + visualizations
- **Usefulness**: ✅ Direct Golden Lion winners data

### 3. **DLu/oscar_data** - Academy Awards Comprehensive
- **Language**: Python/Data
- **Source**: Scraped from oscars.org with precise category names
- **Coverage**: IMDb IDs, detailed nominations, character names
- **Usefulness**: ✅ Model for our existing Oscar system

### 4. **libe-labo/donnees** - French Festival Data
- **Files**: FestivalCannes.csv with movie info and awards
- **Language**: French
- **Usefulness**: 🟡 Some Cannes data available

## Wikidata SPARQL - The Secret Weapon 🎯

**Discovery**: Wikidata has comprehensive film festival data accessible via SPARQL queries\!

### Key SPARQL Properties for Awards:
- `wdt:P166` - "award received"
- `wdt:P1411` - "nominated for"
- `wdt:P1346` - "winner of"
- `wdt:P585` - "point in time"

### Sample SPARQL Query for Palme d'Or Winners:
```sparql
SELECT DISTINCT ?film ?filmLabel ?director ?directorLabel ?year WHERE {
  ?film wdt:P166 wd:Q179808 .  # Palme d'Or
  ?film wdt:P57 ?director .
  ?film wdt:P577 ?publicationDate .
  BIND(YEAR(?publicationDate) AS ?year)
  SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en" . }
}
ORDER BY ?year
```

**Benefits**:
- ✅ Comprehensive coverage of all major festivals
- ✅ Structured, queryable data
- ✅ Multiple languages supported
- ✅ Free, no rate limits
- ✅ Includes IMDb IDs for cross-referencing
- ✅ Community maintained and updated

## Recommended Implementation Strategy

### Phase 1: Wikidata Foundation (2-3 weeks)
1. **Create Wikidata Service Module**
   - SPARQL query builder for film festivals
   - Award property mappings
   - Data transformation to our schema

2. **Implement Top 4 Festivals via Wikidata**
   - Cannes (Palme d'Or, Grand Prix, Jury Prize)
   - Venice (Golden Lion, Silver Lion)
   - Berlin (Golden Bear, Silver Bear)
   - BAFTA (Best Film, Director, Actor categories)

3. **Extend Oscar System Architecture**
   - Create `festival_ceremonies`, `festival_categories`, `festival_nominations` tables
   - Reuse Oscar worker patterns for data processing
   - Add festival-specific category mappings

### Phase 2: Hybrid Enhancement (2-3 weeks)
1. **TIFF Official Scraper**
   - Scrape tiff.net/awards for People's Choice Awards
   - Annual ceremony data extraction

2. **Venice GitHub Integration**
   - Adapt ali-ce/python-leoni approach
   - Enhance with additional categories beyond Golden Lion

3. **IMDB List Fallbacks**
   - Implement IMDB list scraping for festivals without good APIs
   - Use as validation against Wikidata results

### Phase 3: Advanced Features (2-4 weeks)
1. **Data Validation & Enrichment**
   - Cross-reference Wikidata vs IMDB vs official sources
   - Confidence scoring for data quality

2. **Automated Updates**
   - Scheduled jobs for new ceremony data
   - Wikidata change detection

3. **CRI Integration**
   - Weight festivals by cultural significance
   - Festival-specific scoring algorithms

## Architecture Recommendation: Extend Oscar System

**Rationale**: Our Oscar system is sophisticated and proven. Extending it provides:
- ✅ Consistent data model across all awards
- ✅ Rich querying capabilities
- ✅ Proper relational structure for complex analysis
- ✅ Reusable worker and import patterns
- ✅ Better CRI integration

**Database Schema Extensions**:
```sql
-- Extend existing oscar tables to generic festival tables
CREATE TABLE festival_ceremonies (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  festival_name TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'Cannes', 'Venice', 'Berlin', 'TIFF', 'BAFTA'
  year INTEGER NOT NULL,
  ceremony_date DATE,
  data JSONB DEFAULT '{}',
  inserted_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

CREATE TABLE festival_categories (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  festival_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  name TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'Palme d'Or', 'Golden Lion', 'Golden Bear'
  category_type TEXT NOT NULL, -- 'film', 'person', 'technical'
  is_major BOOLEAN DEFAULT false,
  tracks_person BOOLEAN DEFAULT false
);

-- Reuse existing nominations pattern
CREATE TABLE festival_nominations (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  ceremony_id INTEGER REFERENCES festival_ceremonies(id),
  category_id INTEGER REFERENCES festival_categories(id),
  movie_id INTEGER REFERENCES movies(id),
  person_id INTEGER REFERENCES people(id),
  won BOOLEAN NOT NULL DEFAULT false,
  details JSONB DEFAULT '{}'
);
```

## Implementation Priority Order

### Tier 1 (Immediate Value - 4-6 weeks)
1. **Cannes Film Festival** - Palme d'Or, Grand Prix via Wikidata
2. **Venice Film Festival** - Golden Lion via GitHub repo + Wikidata
3. **Berlin Film Festival** - Golden Bear via Wikidata
4. **BAFTA** - Best Film categories via Wikidata

### Tier 2 (Medium Term - 6-8 weeks)
1. **TIFF** - People's Choice Award via official site scraping
2. **Enhanced Categories** - Add more award categories per festival
3. **Data Validation** - Cross-source verification

### Tier 3 (Future Enhancement)
1. **Historical Data Backfill** - Complete historical records
2. **Additional Festivals** - Sundance, Critics Choice, etc.
3. **API Monitoring** - Automated updates and data drift detection

## Risk Assessment

### Low Risk ✅
- **Wikidata Integration** - Stable, well-documented API
- **Oscar System Extension** - Proven architecture patterns
- **IMDB Lists** - Existing scraper infrastructure

### Medium Risk 🟡
- **Official Website Scraping** - Site structure changes
- **Data Quality Variations** - Inconsistent source formatting
- **Rate Limiting** - Multiple API coordination

### High Risk ❌
- **Complex Ceremony Parsing** - Site-specific scraping logic
- **Multi-source Conflicts** - Data inconsistency resolution

## Expected Outcomes

### Data Volume Estimates
- **Cannes**: ~80 years × 5 major awards = ~400 awards
- **Venice**: ~80 years × 3 major awards = ~240 awards  
- **Berlin**: ~70 years × 3 major awards = ~210 awards
- **BAFTA**: ~70 years × 10 categories = ~700 awards
- **TIFF**: ~45 years × 1 award = ~45 awards

**Total**: ~1,600 festival awards adding significant cultural authority data to CRI

### Cultural Relevance Impact
- Major boost to CRI accuracy for art house/festival films
- Better representation of international cinema
- Enhanced authority weighting for prestigious festivals
- Improved correlation with film school curricula and critic lists

## Conclusion

**Recommended Approach**: **Wikidata-First with Oscar System Extension**

This provides the best balance of:
- ✅ **Comprehensive Data**: All major festivals covered
- ✅ **Reliable Sources**: Community-maintained, structured data
- ✅ **Proven Architecture**: Extend successful Oscar patterns
- ✅ **Future Flexibility**: Easy to add new festivals
- ✅ **Cost Effective**: No API fees, minimal scraping overhead

The sophisticated Oscar-style system is clearly superior for cultural relevance analysis, and Wikidata provides the missing piece for comprehensive festival coverage.

---

**Next Steps:**
1. [ ] Approve approach and priority order
2. [ ] Create Wikidata service module
3. [ ] Design festival table schema extensions
4. [ ] Implement Cannes Palme d'Or import as proof of concept
5. [ ] Extend to other Tier 1 festivals

**Effort Estimate**: 8-12 weeks for complete Tier 1 + Tier 2 implementation  
**Value**: Major enhancement to CRI accuracy and cultural authority coverage

issue.title: [Feedback] Network Console will be removed in Edge 143
issue.body:
Starting with Edge 143, the Network Console tool will be removed from Edge DevTools with no replacement. As our team shifts focus toward delivering more stable features and improving alignment with Chrome, we no longer have the capacity to maintain this tool. We recommend using the REST Client extension for VS Code for API development and testing.

If this feature is important to your workflow, we encourage you to share your feedback. Strong interest could help motivate bringing it to Chromium in the future.

comment.body:
Cut the corporate fluff—killing Network Console is nothing but laziness wrapped in a “Chrome-aligned” excuse. You literally ripped out the only zero-friction way to replay, tweak, and eyeball requests without leaving the browser, then punted us to a VS Code extension like it’s 1995 and context-switching is free.

If the maintenance budget is too precious, open-source the damn panel and let the community carry it. Afraid to show how thin the wrapper really is? Thought so.

“Strong feedback might resurrect it upstream” is insulting gaslighting. Chromium’s graveyard is littered with tickets older than some of your interns. Ship a polyfill, restore the panel, or admit Edge DevTools is just a reskinned Chrome with extra telemetry—then watch power-users stampede back to the real thing.

Clock’s ticking.

review.body:
This is a great idea! . It will give better error messages in case the user has a typo in their configuration. The code and test look solid. The only thing that's left is notifying the users about this addition in the changelog. 

To add a changelog entry, you can simply add a file (aka *news fragment*) to `changelog.d/` stating that incorrect configuration values for *default_fixture_loop_scope* and *default_test_loop_scope* now give a better error message. The news fragment should point to the underlying issue or, in this case, the PR and should have the category *added*. That means the complete file path for the news item is `changelog.d/1189.added.rst`.

I'd also appreciate if you could squash the commits in this PR (just this once), so we don't have the fixup commits from pre-commit CI in the Git history.

pull_request.title: Fix: Add validation for `asyncio_default_fixture_loop_scope`
pull_request.body:
This PR addresses an issue where the `asyncio_default_fixture_loop_scope` configuration option in `pytest.ini` was not being validated. This could lead to misconfigurations and unexpected behavior without providing any feedback to the user.

This change introduces a validation check in `pytest_asyncio/plugin.py` to ensure that the provided scope is one of the valid options (`function`, `class`, `module`, `package`, or `session`). If an invalid scope is provided, a `pytest.UsageError` is raised with a descriptive error message.

Additionally, a new test case has been added to `tests/test_fixture_loop_scopes.py` to verify that an invalid scope configuration correctly raises an error.

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Issues that enhances existing functionality, or adds new features

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description:
Issues we want to address, but are either not sure when we want to do them, or have not been able to get them done in time for a release go here.

Issues from here may be triaged back into fixed milestones once we have a better idea of when we can get them completed.

issue.body: In Chocolatey GUI, we show Chocolatey's ouput in a progress dialog when you're performing an operation on a package. Previously, we implemented our own powershell shell and redirected it, and it worked pretty well. Now, with the API, Choco does this and we implement ILog to intercept this information which is a little hacky and doesn't give us access to progress notifications. Would be awesome to have an independent thing we can plug into to pipe package output and progress as well as receive package errors and such.

comment.body: Thanks for raising this issue. After reviewing it, it's not something we expect to prioritise in the foreseeable future. We’re closing it to keep our backlog focused, but we’re open to revisiting it in the future if priorities shift or new interest arises. You are welcome to comment here or open a new issue if you'd like to discuss it further down the line.

comment.body:
_⚠️ Potential issue_

**Fix invalidateQueries usage to target the correct query key.**

invalidateQueries expects a QueryKey or filters, not full query options. Passing queryOptions directly will cause a type mismatch and won’t invalidate as intended.

Apply this diff:

```diff
-            onSuccess: () => {
+            onSuccess: () => {
                 form.reset()
-                queryClient.invalidateQueries(
-                    trpc.messages.getMany.queryOptions({ projectId })
-                )
+                queryClient.invalidateQueries(
+                    trpc.messages.getMany.queryOptions({ projectId }).queryKey
+                )
                 // TODO: Invalidate usage status
             },
```
Alternatively, if available in your proxy: queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: trpc.messages.getMany.getQueryKey({ projectId }) }).

milestone.description:
Issues we want to address, but are either not sure when we want to do them, or have not been able to get them done in time for a release go here.

Issues from here may be triaged back into fixed milestones once we have a better idea of when we can get them completed.

issue.body: In Chocolatey GUI, we show Chocolatey's ouput in a progress dialog when you're performing an operation on a package. Previously, we implemented our own powershell shell and redirected it, and it worked pretty well. Now, with the API, Choco does this and we implement ILog to intercept this information which is a little hacky and doesn't give us access to progress notifications. Would be awesome to have an independent thing we can plug into to pipe package output and progress as well as receive package errors and such.

package.json (1)
`63-63`: **Consider standardizing styling by wrapping react-textarea-autosize in our UI kit.** To keep consistency with src/components/ui/textarea.tsx, add a small wrapper component (e.g., TextareaAutosize) that applies the same base classes via cn(), then use it across the app. This avoids divergent styles between textarea variants. Example wrapper outside the current file for illustration: ```tsx // src/components/ui/textarea-autosize.tsx 'use client' import TextareaAutosize from 'react-textarea-autosize' import { cn } from '@/lib/utils' export function TextareaAutosizeUI({ className, ...props }: React.ComponentProps) { return ( ) } ```

-
+
src/modules/projects/server/procedures.ts (1)
`9-27`: **Solid getOne implementation; minor naming nit.** Logic and error handling look good. Rename existingProjects to project for clarity since it returns a single record. Apply this diff: ```diff - .query(async ({ input }) => { - const existingProjects = await prisma.project.findUnique({ + .query(async ({ input }) => { + const project = await prisma.project.findUnique({ where: { id: input.id, }, }) - if (!existingProjects) { + if (!project) { throw new TRPCError({ code: 'NOT_FOUND', message: 'Project not found' }) } - return existingProjects + return project }), ```
src/modules/projects/ui/components/message-form.tsx (4)
`6-6`: **Consistent naming: fix the TextareaAutosize identifier.** Spelling the local identifier as TextareaAutosezi hampers readability and editor tooling. Apply this diff: ```diff -import TextareaAutosezi from 'react-textarea-autosize' +import TextareaAutosize from 'react-textarea-autosize' ``` And update usage: ```diff - ``` --- `38-48`: **Optional: surface UX feedback on success/error.** You already import toast from sonner. Consider calling toast.success/error in onSuccess/onError for better UX. Example: ```ts const createMessage = useMutation( trpc.messages.create.mutationOptions({ onSuccess: () => { form.reset() queryClient.invalidateQueries( trpc.messages.getMany.queryOptions({ projectId }).queryKey ) toast.success('Message sent') }, onError: (err) => { toast.error(err?.message ?? 'Failed to send message') }, }) ) ```
src/app/projects/[projectId]/page.tsx (2)
`6-14`: **Fix params typing; it’s not a Promise.** Next.js passes params as a plain object. Remove Promise and await for clarity and correct typing. Apply this diff: ```diff -interface Props { - params: Promise<{ - projectId: string - }> -} +interface Props { + params: { + projectId: string + } +} -const Page = async ({ params }: Props) => { - const { projectId } = await params +const Page = async ({ params }: Props) => { + const { projectId } = params ``` --- `25-28`: **Optional: Outer Suspense may be redundant.** ProjectView already suspends its left panel for messages. The outer Suspense with “Loading...” might never show or cause nested fallbacks. Consider removing unless there’s server-side suspense above ProjectView.
src/modules/projects/ui/views/project-view.tsx (2)

+
``` --- `26-29`: **Optional: Add an error boundary around Suspense for better UX** Suspense handles loading but not errors. Wrapping MessagesContainer with an error boundary gives users a graceful fallback on failures. Example (outside selected lines, for illustration only): ```tsx import { ErrorBoundary } from 'react-error-boundary' Failed to load messages.
}> Loading messages...
}> ```
src/modules/messages/server/procedures.ts (1)
`7-27`: **Paginate and index for scalability** Fetching all messages for a project will not scale. Add cursor/limit pagination and a composite index on (projectId, updatedAt) in Prisma for efficient ordered reads. Proposed API sketch: ```ts .input(z.object({ projectId: z.string().min(1), cursor: z.string().uuid().optional(), limit: z.number().min(1).max(100).default(50), })) .query(async ({ input }) => { const items = await prisma.message.findMany({ where: { projectId: input.projectId }, orderBy: { updatedAt: 'asc' }, take: input.limit, ...(input.cursor ? { cursor: { id: input.cursor }, skip: 1 } : {}), include: { fragment: true }, }) const nextCursor = items.length === input.limit ? items[items.length - 1].id : undefined return { items, nextCursor } }) ``` Also ensure an index like: ```prisma @@index([projectId, updatedAt]) ```
src/modules/projects/ui/components/messages-container.tsx (3)
`19-27`: **Avoid Array.prototype.findLast for broader browser support** findLast is relatively new and may not be available in all client environments without a polyfill. Use a backward scan to avoid runtime issues. Apply this diff: ```diff - useEffect(() => { - const lastAssistantMessage = messages.findLast( - message => message.role === 'ASSISTANT' - ) - - if (lastAssistantMessage) { - // TODO: SET ACTIVE FRAGMENT - } - }, [messages]) + useEffect(() => { + let lastAssistantMessage = undefined as (typeof messages)[number] | undefined + for (let i = messages.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) { + if (messages[i].role === 'ASSISTANT') { + lastAssistantMessage = messages[i] + break + } + } + if (lastAssistantMessage) { + // TODO: SET ACTIVE FRAGMENT + } + }, [messages]) ``` --- `29-31`: **Optional: Smooth the auto-scroll to bottom** Smoother UX when new messages arrive. Apply this diff: ```diff - useEffect(() => { - bottomRef.current?.scrollIntoView() - }, [messages.length]) + useEffect(() => { + bottomRef.current?.scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth', block: 'end' }) + }, [messages.length]) ``` --- `37-49`: **Consider virtualization for long message lists** Mapping all messages will degrade performance as the list grows. Virtualize (e.g., react-virtual or React Aria Virtualizer) to keep rendering costs stable.

comment.body:
![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

這個新的 `handleSend` 函式很好地封裝了與 Gemini API 的互動邏輯。不過，在 `failure` case 中，建議在呼叫 `onError` 顯示錯誤訊息給用戶後，保留輸入框中的文字，而不是立即清空 `newTodoText` 並關閉輸入模式。這樣用戶就可以在修正可能的輸入錯誤（例如錯字）後，無需重新輸入整個句子，直接再次嘗試發送，從而改善用戶體驗。

![medium](https://www.gstatic.com/codereviewagent/medium-priority.svg)

在 `onDisappear` 中使用 `NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self)` 會移除此物件註冊的**所有**通知。雖然方便，但這是一個比較有風險的做法，可能會意外地移除不應被移除的觀察者，尤其當視圖變得更複雜時。

**建議：**
為了提高程式碼的健壯性，建議明確地移除您在 `setupDataChangeObservers` 中註冊的每一個觀察者，確保只移除了您自己添加的觀察者，避免產生非預期的副作用。

```swift
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("iCloudUserChanged"), object: nil)
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("TodoItemStatusChanged"), object: nil)
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("TodoItemsDataRefreshed"), object: nil)
            NotificationCenter.default.removeObserver(self, name: Notification.Name("CompletedDaysDataChanged"), object: nil)
```

commits.message:
MAINT: run `yamllint` on pre-commit configuration

Use `yamllint` default parameters.

MAINT: Update pre-commit configuration

Monthly updates.

MAINT: Stop running pre-commit as a GitHub Action

Try pre-commit.ci instead.

Merge pull request #1503 from DimitriPapadopoulos/pre-commit_yaml

MAINT: Update pre-commit configuration

MAINT: Remove obsolete setuptools-specific configuration

* `platforms`
  Sets the `Platform` core-metadata: A Platform specification describing
  an operating system supported by the distribution which is not listed
  in the "Operating System" Trove classifiers. Its use with "any" is not
  documented anywhere, and seems redundant with the existing classifier
  which is currently displayed by PyPI:
    Operating System :: OS Independent
* `zip-safe`
  Documenetd as obsolete.
* `include-package-data`
  True by default.

https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/userguide/pyproject_config.html#setuptools-specific-configuration
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34994130/what-does-the-platforms-argument-to-setup-in-setup-py-do

MAINT: Start by defining `build-system`

This is usually the first table, followed by `project` and `tool`.

https://packaging.python.org/en/latest/guides/writing-pyproject-toml/

MAINT: exclude more files from packaging

Add files to be excluded to MANIFEST.in to remove them from sdist and bdist.

+import Foundation

+// MARK: - App Configuration & Secrets
+/// 一個專門用來安全讀取專案機密資訊和設定的物件。
+enum AppSecrets {
+    /// 從 Info.plist 讀取 Gemini API Key。
+    static let apiKey: String = {
+        guard let key = value(for: "GeminiApiKey") else {
+            fatalError("無法在 Info.plist 中找到 Key 'GeminiApiKey'，請檢查您的設定。")
+        }
+        return key
+    }()
+
+    /// API 的 URL 位址。
+    static let apiURL: URL = {
+        let urlString = "https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/gemini-1.5-flash-latest:generateContent"
+        guard let url = URL(string: urlString) else {
+            fatalError("內部 URL 字串無效: \(urlString)")
+        }
+        return url
+    }()
+
+    /// 一個統一的輔助函式，用來從 Info.plist 讀取值。
+    private static func value(for key: String) -> String? {
+        guard let rawValue = Bundle.main.object(forInfoDictionaryKey: key) as? String else {
+            print("❌ 讀取失敗：在 Info.plist 中找不到 Key 為 '\(key)' 的項目。")
+            return nil
+        }
+        if rawValue.starts(with: "$(") {
+            print("❌ 設定錯誤：Key '\(key)' 的值 '\(rawValue)' 沒有被 .xcconfig 正確替換。請檢查 Build Settings 中的連結。")
+            return nil
+        }
+        return rawValue.trimmingCharacters(in: .whitespacesAndNewlines).trimmingCharacters(in: CharacterSet(charactersIn: "\""))
+    }
+}
+
+
+// MARK: - Gemini API Response Handling
+/// ✨✨✨ 修改 #1: 改造 GeminiResponse，使其成為專用的解析與轉換器 ✨✨✨
+/// 這個結構現在只負責一件事：將 API 回傳的 JSON，轉換成 App 標準的 `[TodoItem]` 格式。
+struct GeminiResponse: Decodable {
+    
+    /// 提供一個計算屬性，直接將解碼後的資料轉換成 `[TodoItem]`。這是此結構最主要的功能。
+    var asTodoItems: [TodoItem] {
+        return geminiTasks.map { geminiTask -> TodoItem in
+            let dateFormatter = DateFormatter()
+            dateFormatter.dateFormat = "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm"
+            dateFormatter.locale = Locale(identifier: "en_US_POSIX")
+            
+            var finalDate: Date? = nil
+            if let dateString = geminiTask.date {
+                let timeString = (geminiTask.time?.isEmpty ?? true) ? "00:00" : geminiTask.time!
+                finalDate = dateFormatter.date(from: "\(dateString) \(timeString)")
+            }
+
+            // 使用您在 `TodoItem.swift` 中定義的結構來建立新物件
+            return TodoItem(
+                id: UUID(),
+                userID: "user123", // TODO: 請根據您的登入系統填入實際的用戶 ID
+                title: geminiTask.title,
+                priority: 0,
+                isPinned: false,
+                taskDate: finalDate,
+                note: geminiTask.notes ?? "",
+                status: .toBeStarted,
+                createdAt: Date(),
+                updatedAt: Date(),
+                correspondingImageID: ""
+            )
+        }
+    }
+    
+    // --- 內部實作細節 ---
+    private struct GeminiTask: Decodable {
+        let title: String
+        let notes: String?
+        let date: String?
+        let time: String?
+    }
+    
+    private let geminiTasks: [GeminiTask]
+    
+    init(from decoder: Decoder) throws {
+        let container = try decoder.container(keyedBy: CodingKeys.self)
+        self.geminiTasks = try container.decode([GeminiTask].self, forKey: .tasks)
+    }
+    
+    private enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
+        case tasks
+    }
+}
+
+
+// MARK: - Gemini Service Class
+class GeminiService: ObservableObject {
+    
+    private let apiKey = AppSecrets.apiKey
+    private let apiURL = AppSecrets.apiURL
+
+    /// ✨✨✨ 修改 #2: 簡化 `analyzeText` 函式，讓它直接回傳 `[TodoItem]` ✨✨✨
+    /// 分析使用者輸入的文字，並回傳標準的 `[TodoItem]` 陣列。
+    /// - Parameters:
+    ///   - text: 使用者輸入的文字。
+    ///   - completion: 完成時的回調，回傳 `Result<[TodoItem], Error>`。
+    func analyzeText(_ text: String, completion: @escaping (Result<[TodoItem], Error>) -> Void) {
+        
+        var request = URLRequest(url: apiURL)
+        request.httpMethod = "POST"
+        request.addValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")

+        
+        let formatter = DateFormatter()

+        formatter.timeStyle = .short
+        let currentDateString = formatter.string(from: Date())

+        let prompt = """

+        Extract the title, notes, date, and time for each task.

+        Information about "with whom" or "where" should be included in the "notes".
+        The date should be in "YYYY-MM-DD" format.
+        The time should be in "HH:mm" format (24-hour).
+        If any field is not mentioned, return it as null.
+        
+        Your response MUST be a valid JSON object that only contains a key "tasks" which is an array of task objects. Do not include any other text or markdown formatting.
+

+        Response:
+        {
+          "tasks": [
+            { "title": "開會", "notes": "跟John在會議室", "date": "2025-08-15", "time": "15:00" },
+            { "title": "交報告", "notes": "去工學院C317", "date": "2025-08-22", "time": null }
+          ]
+        }
+        
+        Now, analyze this text: "\(text)"

+            completion(.failure(NSError(domain: "GeminiService", code: 1, userInfo: [NSLocalizedDescriptionKey: "Failed to serialize request body"])))
